title: What happened to League after season 5
body:
I am playing LoL for 8 years now, and i never felt this bad about the game before. (Maybe when they nerfed the shit out kassadin)

Last 3 years was so bad for LoL, and each season it only kept getting worse.

Every single rule of league (excluding chasing singed) has been removed.

**What riot did in last 3 years;**

"Oh {{champion:76}} can one shot people with one Q, thats not right, one single mistake shouldn't cost you the game, we must change this and make nidalee much more of a hunter instead of Q spamming champion"

My problem with Zoe is her sleepy trouble bubble. It already makes you a sitting duck for her long range nuke... Why does it also have damage amp?

My problem with Talon: Assassin- High damage front loaded burst. Also has insane wave clear. Also has unmatched roam potential with a crazy number of routes he can take because of wall hops. What is Talon's trade off, exactly?

Well, same goes for Aurelion Sol.

Also, playing against Talon isnt that hard tho, poking mages with CC (Like Ahri, Cassio, Aurelion Sol) can fuck the shit out of talon if they play right. 
Also; Talon has to go in melee range to finish his job, which makes him super vulnerable. Unlike old talon, he cant dodge skillshots and his Point and click leap makes his moves predictable.

If you think about number of CCs in the game, Talon is not even a problem, people like to blind their eyes and farm in lane and when they get fucked by a Talon they cry about champion.

Personally for me the worst meta was the Argent Censer meta. At least both teams no longer have to be forced to pick a Marksmen in this mega-burst meta. The worst season in general has to be season 6 Dynamic Que era. Having said that yes there are still major problems in the game, and now to answer your question, or most of it hopefully.

A new team took over League. The old guard had no clue what to do with League, BUT they sure as hell knew what not to do. The new guard have no clue what to do, AND no clue what not to do with League. The old team made changes that were strategic and balanced focused. New team hates strategy and prefers flashy, and even stated they make changes for the sake of change. Change for the sake of change? No wonder League is slowly breaking apart. Change must have a purpose or else it will fail.

Removal of old masteries and runes to be replaced by new masteries, and then these new runes we have. Threw strategy and unique play styles out in favor of flashy play styles. Balance is destroyed, people pick the op runes instead of any runes that fit their playstyle or else they would lose. Towers are useless and kept receiving nerfs which forced snowball and short games. 1 mistake can cost the game which causes a lot of stress.

I believe it was stated that the Aatrox rework was not meant for Aatrox mains and was for everyone else. That was because the % of Aatrox mains was small. Which is one of the many reasons why it is the worst rework of all time. What's the point of maining a champion you love? You might as well just main the popular champions because they'll stay around forever and never have drastic changes both kit and lore wise. 

Topping off Aatrox's failed rework statement is how can this be stated AFTER Warwick's rework? Warwick's rework not only kept his kit and lore, but vastly improved both. Not only were the mains happy but everyone else, with the exception of the haters, were happy with it. It was done well because someone was able to keep CertainlyT in line with the rework, kept control of his imagination in a balanced way. Why can't they do more of that? Warwick's rework is in direct competition with #1 rework with Sion's rework, which is Riot's "Golden Rework." That speaks volumes on the success of the rework.

Basically long story short, new team causing a lot of screw ups over the past 3 years that are catching up.

Playing since season 4, I truly love(d) the strategic gameplay for SR and even ARAM .   I am so annoyed with the game now, as the core elements of what I enjoyed about the game are gradually being removed from the game.   

-I enjoyed the ability to play the role of tank or protective support, without getting blown up in seconds.  
-I enjoyed the design of a lot of the old champs(which have mostly been reworked).
-Mobility champs were minimal back in season 4, are now the norm, this is not fun for me.
-I enjoyed the customization of runes and masteries, now we have this crap.
-ARAMS are not even fun anymore to me due to the high damage. 

The rose colored glasses may be on to a certain extent, but this game was better before season 8.    Many things in the past were tolerable because of the core elements in the game that I liked... which barely exist now.  

Its all been said in other posts, but I am seriously at the point where the addiction to the game is waning.  I am not going to insult RIOT , but they have pretty much lost my interest in playing anymore.  I only play now because of boredom(going through the motions), not because of excitement or desire to improve.

Seriously though...I feel like the Season Of Our Discontent (Season 8) is being caused by two main issues:

1.  A fetish for burst/proc damage that triggers on dashes, fueled by {{item:3147}} {{item:3095}} {{item:3078}} and inspired by teh flashy LCS plays.  The issue of Riot favoring what makes a flashy game for the pros over a balanced game for the masses has been discussed before, but I have to say I feel like it is true at this point.  I know these items are broken because I abuse them, I watch others abuse them, you have to abuse them to win, and to me they seem to be a fundamental cause of the so-called "damage meta".
2.  The zone control/mobility creep in new champions and champion reworks.  Compare {{champion:142}}  {{champion:266}} {{champion:50}} {{champion:516}} or new{{champion:84}}  to champs like {{champion:60}} {{champion:10}} {{champion:80}} and it immediately becomes apparent that anyone released or reworked in the last year or two has more chains, combos, dashes, and generally active buttons that do things during fights than older champions, and if you do them all properly with the new ones, you generally win.  Again, LCS flashiness helps fuel this.  Many buttons give commentators lots of cheers and catcalls for those who hit or miss them, but it starts to make the base game feel like something other than it used to be.

The poster boy that throws this all into stark relief is {{champion:20}}.

It makes sense that he's the next remake, but I also want us all to take a moment and remember the simpler, cleaner, and in many ways more enjoyable game that the old version of the yeti represented.  

Goodness, I remember when I could take him top (back in S2), and when I could jungle with him (what he's still supposed to do) without getting utterly dumpstered by early-game skirmishers fighting over scuttle crabs. 

 Remember that?  Remember when?  Pepperidge Farm remembers.

Let's take a moment to remember that game, because it is about to be slashed into pieces by everything that new {{champion:84}} represents.
